meanings.definition: The act or process of choosing a person for a position by voting.
meanings.sent1: During the school elections, students voted for their favorite class president.
meanings.sent2: In democratic countries, citizens participate in elections to select their leaders.
meanings.sent3: The cat's meows sounded like it was campaigning for the title of 'cutest pet' in the household elections.
meanings.sent4: The battle between the two rival companies for market dominance was like a fierce election campaign.
meanings.sent5: The excitement and tension in the air during the national elections were palpable.

meanings.definition: The right or ability to vote in a political election.
meanings.sent1: Every citizen should cherish their right to participate in elections and make their voices heard.
meanings.sent2: People in the country fought for years to gain the freedom to exercise their right to elections.
meanings.sent3: The dog proudly wagged its tail, feeling like it had won a prize for having the cutest bark in the neighborhood elections.
meanings.sent4: The power of the people's collective voice in elections can shape the future of a nation.
meanings.sent5: The importance of fair and free elections cannot be overstated in a democratic society.

meanings.definition: A formal decision-making process where people choose between options.
meanings.sent1: The family held elections to decide on the destination for their next vacation.
meanings.sent2: In a board meeting, the members conducted elections to select the new chairman.
meanings.sent3: The ants seemed to be having their own elections to determine the best route to the picnic crumbs.
meanings.sent4: The market research team conducted elections to finalize the new product design.
meanings.sent5: The town hall meetings allowed for open discussions before the final elections on the community project.
